name: Cupid's Bower
description: Achimenes erecta (syn. A. coccinea), commonly known as Cupid's Bower, Nut Orchid, or Magic Flower, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America, particularly Mexico and Guatemala. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and features trailing stems (30-60 cm long) with groups of hairy, heart-shaped, dark green leaves. Despite its name, this plant is a trailing achimenes. It produces a display of bright red flowers and dark green foliage. The reddish green stem carries groups of hairy, heart-shaped leaves. The flowers last only a few days, but are produced over a period lasting all the way from June to October. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds vibrant colors with its bright red flowers. It's popular among gesneriad enthusiasts for its long flowering period.
careTips: Keep substrate consistently moist but not waterlogged
Allow to go dormant in winter
